The best available introduction to project finance for developers, lenders and other project participants. Come rapidly up to speed via a step-by-step introduction to this critical financial technique.




Media Sponsors:












Structure projects to utilize non- or limited-recourse,
  off-balance-sheet debt

Learn how to identify, evaluate and allocate the risks in
  your project to maximize your flexibility, liquidity,
  and profits

Understand how to source capital for your project via
          the equity, commercial bank, B-loan, private placement
          and financial guarantee markets


Because project finance permits the use of large amounts of limited    
          recourse debt, it will be used to finance hundreds of billions of dollars
          in private infrastructure projects worldwide this year. This increasingly
          critical financial technique replaces collateral with contractual
          agreements, permitting deals to be constructed that provide maximum
          flexibility, liquidity, tax benefits and profits.          
This program will take you step by step through the issues that are
          essential to all project financings. An introduction lays out how a
          successful project financing will analyze and allocate project risks
          contractually to create the stable cash flows that are the bedrock of this
          financing technique. This is followed by talks from several key parties
          to those contracts, discussing each type of project risk and how those
          risks will be assumed or mitigated. Then we hear from speakers who
          will brief us on what is required in today’s equity, bank debt, B-loan,
          private placement and financial guarantee markets to source capital for
          your project. Finally, we provide two in-depth examinations of real-world
          project financings.          
Please review our complete program and remarkable list of speakers
          and reserve your place today.
